p.seg: When some (plant) is entangled do not cut it,
when some (plant) is about to rise to not destroy it,
when some (plant) is about to give sprouts do not carve it out,
so if you meet a bad time,
with continuous disasters form Heaven,
it will not destroy you and you will not be overthrown.
When one makes good things fortune will come,
when one makes bad things disaster will most likely come.
Do not repair a worn out wall,
do not raise up a dejected man,
What is rejected by the august Heaven,
is what is hated by the Lord.
Obscure means very dim,
Heaven above has orders for the ones below,
daytime [...],
[...] forgive,
the length of a pole,
Crooked tree roots overthrow a cart,
those good at travel die below a bridge,
wild beasts eat tigers.
Heaven provides the right occasion,
Earth provides disposition,
the people provide strength,
the enlightened king should not worry,
these are referred to as the three virtues.
Herbs and trees wait for the right time
and then rise.
What Heaven dislikes one should not like;
one should not cry at dawn,
one should not sing at dusk,
one should observe respectfully the X and Y phases of the moon,
this is called to observe the standard of Heaven.
Who respect it gets it,
who is lazy loses it,
this is the standard of Heaven.
The heavenly spirits [...]
august Heaven will make it rise.
One should not act falsely,
or the Lord on High would hate him.
When one sets a time and then does not respect the time,
Heaven will send down disasters;
when something should finish and then it does not finish,
heaven sends down anomalies.
One’s body will not reach its natural end,
until one’s descendants.
When something should be luminous and instead it is dark,
this is called a great grief.
When something should be dark and instead it is luminous,
this is called inauspicious.
When things are very orderly and regular,
things inside and outside have separation,
when males and females are moderate,
this is called ritual propriety.
Respect it, respect it,
【3】the mandate of Heaven is very bright.
If one goes against it,
he will necessarily meet disasters.
Do not brig evil to ministers (?) on the side of the spirits.
Do not enjoy idleness.
if to acquire profit,
one damages his intimates
this is called to sin.
If the ruler does not have a chief minister,
this is called dangerous.
The state is ruined.
In worries
as in happy times,
one should not call it not daring something (?),
one should not call it not being like this (?).
When the old rules are not considered advantegeous,
the state loses the rules,
a small state is smashed (?),
a big state exceedingly hurt.
When one changes the standards and changes the rites,
the earth breaks up,
the people die before time.
Good, good, three times good,
the pillar of happiness.
If one passes and transforms it [...]
[...] it cannot advance.
When the gentleman is not careful about his virtue,
within the four areas,
this is the gate of the Lord.
If one approaches the people with humanity,
nobody among the people will not be intimate with him.
If one makes the people’s affairs prosperous and exalted,
they come and go observing his arrival (?).
those which the people love.
are the ones the lord on high blesses.
In each case to evaluate the officials’ attitude towards people,
this is called to have a strong state.
To evaluate the people’s attitude towards the officials,
this is called to have a state in chaos.
To establish the five officials and not to employ them,
this is called to contravene the rules.
The earth would break,
the people be lost.
Not setting limits to joy and music,
this is called great chaos,
the august Heaven will not forgive it,
and it must give retribution to it with grief and loss.
In general not to set limits to eating and drinking,
this is called great gluttony (?),
the Lord on High will not forgive it,
and it must give retribution to it with loss,
the Lord on High will not forgive it,
and therefore sacrifices will not be enjoyed.
The state increases fourfold (on four sides?),
this is called to bloom,
even if it expands it must get empty (again) [this kind of development is too fast to endure].
For palaces and homes to exceed measure,
this is what the august Heaven hates,
even if they are established one will not live there.
When clothes exceed their measures,
they loose in beauty,
this is called to be against the standards,
the august Heaven will not forgive it,
ghosts and spirits will (not enjoy) sacrifices,
the august Lord will be inactive,
and the state and families will decay.
If one respects the prohibitions of Heaven,
causes the extension (boldness?) of Earth to rise (?),
the constant way must ?.
Oh Heaven, oh man,
based on what are they intimate,
until his end.
If one knows Heaven it is enough to follow the right time,
if one knows Earth it is enough to make natural characteristics strong,
if one knows people it is enough to congregate intimates.
If one does not refine its accomplishments
but listens to its entanglements (?),
all things will not proceed and the planned affairs will not succeed.
If one looks up to Heaven and serves his lord,
with strictness and diligence one will necessarily be trusted.
If one looks down to Earth,
and works the land with respect and diligence,
there will be nothing that he will do which he is not able to do,
and nothing which he is able to do and which he changes.
If one rushes in appropriating the allotted time of the people,
Heaven-sent famine will certainly come.
If one appropriates the time of the people to work the land,
this is called delay,
one will worry perpetually,
one will necessarily loose the harvest.
To appropriate the time of the people to work on water conservancy,
this is called to drown (the people).
Loss will follow joy,
and from every side will come protests.
To appropriate the time of the people to do military service,
this [is called cruelty.
Disaster will follow every harvest,
nobody will work with the sickle and mow.]
If one is not lazy with the allotted time,
the Lord will be pleased with him,
and there will be no disasters.
[...] protect,
there will be no disasters.
Gao Yang said:
“Do not wear inappropriate clothes to perform a sacrifice,
do not wear plain clothes in dealing with funerary practices.
xxxx is called to forget the spirits [...]
The emperor said:
“Stand.
Do not make clever discourses,
do not try to please people,
do not attempt (excessively) great enterprises,
do not harm the standard.
Do not block up the rivers,
to not cut off the waters,
do not extinguish clans,
do not void storages.
Do not change prohibitions,
do not change affairs.
Do not give troubles to female relatives,
do not bring shame to fathers and elder brothers.
Do not be ashamed of poverty,
do not laugh of punishments,
do not disturb the depths,
do not measure the (height of the) mountains.
Do not be lazy in your person,
do not speak too much.
Do not be lazy in your lodgings,
do not be messy when you rise.
Do not extinguish what is good,
do not do what is not auspicious.
Do not be happy while entering a ruin,
do not sing while climbing a hill,
this is the way to follow the rites of Heaven.
A capital city facing a river,
a city on the banks (of a river),
a family with one hundred vehicles,
the building of ten houses,
palaces on ponds,
in each case one should be careful about the rules,
not losing the proper way.
If one enjoys killing men,
and then does not drink or eat (to purify himself),
your grasp (on power) will be unsecure.
your enactment (of policies) will not be majestic.
There should be grief for the capital punishment,
there should be deliberation in increasing or decreasing (the punishment)
What the people desire,
the ghosts and spirits help it.
One should carefully guard the void xx,
[...]principally because of anger.
When the body is sick,
one dislikes vegetables and food.
When the state is lost,
one dislikes the plans of the saints.
The house will be abandoned,
one will disturb the sacrifices,
only obeying to anger.
In each case being like this,
even if there is no great disaster,
there will necessarily be great shame.
To whom Heaven is defeating,
he multiplies the bribes
and decreases the worries.
When one stands up they raise him up,
when they cause him to fall they do not help him.
